content:
• Wednesday, May 25, 2011
  • FSL

    Freescale Semiconductor (NYSE:FSL) cuts its IPO price by more than 15% to the $18-$20 range in...

    Freescale Semiconductor (NYSE:FSL) cuts its IPO price by more than 15% to the $18-$20 range in the face of tepid investor interest, bringing the size of the offering down to $870M. The PE firms that took the company private in 2006 at $36.12/share stand to see a significant loss.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:12 PM
  • BPI

    A stock soared down the stretch today after a recommendation from. a college student. Sunjay...

    A stock soared down the stretch today after a recommendation from... a college student. Sunjay Gorowara won a stock-picking contest and told the Ira Sohn crowd that Bridgeport Education (BPI +11.8%) has been unfairly lumped in with other for-profit education stocks that have much worse records. The kid's got a gig this summer at JPMorgan (NYSE:JPM).

     
     
     
     
    | 4:27 PM | 4 Comments
  • RL

    Polo Ralph Lauren (RL -9.2%) sinks to the bottom of the S&P after reporting its...

    Polo Ralph Lauren (RL -9.2%) sinks to the bottom of the S&P after reporting its disappointing quarter and big jump in inventories, raising concerns about future markdowns. Costco (COST -1.1%) is lower after taking a $49M accounting charge related to rising prices. Retailers and apparel companies (RTH -0.3%) perk up but continue to lag.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:52 PM
  • HAL

    Oilfield services stocks (OIH +3.2%) continue to power higher on news that gasoline supplies are...

    Oilfield services stocks (OIH +3.2%) continue to power higher on news that gasoline supplies are stabilizing and distillate stocks fell more than expected, combined with an upbeat forecast on the oil services business from Halliburton's (HAL +5.5%) CFO. Perhaps the move bodes well for the broader market: "When there's good news of any sort, you get a little bounce."
     
     
     
     
    | 3:39 PM | 1 Comment
  • NFLX

    Today's strength in Netflix (NFLX +4.8%) is attributed to comments from Mark Zuckerberg that...

    Today's strength in Netflix (NFLX +4.8%) is attributed to comments from Mark Zuckerberg that Facebook has been in discussions with NFLX related to potential integration of social networking tools. Music, TV shows and books will be among the next products to go social through the website, Zuckerberg says.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:08 PM | 2 Comments
  • CRI

    Shares of children's retailer Carter's (CRI +13.7%) spike after the Berkshire Fund reported it...

    Shares of children's retailer Carter's (CRI +13.7%) spike after the Berkshire Fund reported it held a 13.2% stake and could discuss going-private transactions with the company's management, according to an SEC filing. The news fuels speculation the buyout firm will pressure Carter's to entertain takeover offers.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:36 PM
  • MBI

    MBIA (MBI +3.5%) shares tick higher after Sabretooth Capital's Erez Kalir offers bullish...

    MBIA (MBI +3.5%) shares tick higher after Sabretooth Capital's Erez Kalir offers bullish comments at the Ira Sohn conference. Some observers have forecast the demise of MBIA, but Kalir says those fears are overstated, and there are reasons to be optimistic about the company and its leadership team.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:22 PM
  • FSLR

    Solar stocks are headed lower as Jim Chanos calls the industry his favorite idea on the short...

    Solar stocks are headed lower as Jim Chanos calls the industry his favorite idea on the short side at the Ira Sohn Conference. TAN -2.3%, FSLR -2.1%, YGE -3.9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:16 PM | 5 Comments
  • S

    A key Clearwire (CLWR -1.3%) investor urges the company: Boost the stock price by selling...

    A key Clearwire (CLWR -1.3%) investor urges the company: Boost the stock price by selling spectrum. CEO Mike Stanton has ruled out a frequency sale, and Pardus Capital thinks majority owner Sprint Nextel (S +1.4%) is preventing it order to hold CLWR down and ease a later buyout. (previously: CLWR cash crunch)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:44 PM
  • VIA

    Viacom (VIA +0.8%) boosts its quarterly dividend by 67%, to $0.25.

    Viacom (VIA +0.8%) boosts its quarterly dividend by 67%, to $0.25.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:11 PM
  • MOS

    Mosaic (MOS +1.9%) says it's wrapped its split from Cargill, as the privately held giant...

    Mosaic (MOS +1.9%) says it's wrapped its split from Cargill, as the privately held giant distributes its 64% Mosaic stake among various shareholders and debt holders. Mosaic has also finished an offering of 115M common shares.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM

  • Did we miss a QEIII announcement? The entire commodity sector is romping today. SLV +2.9%, JJC...

    Did we miss a QEIII announcement? The entire commodity sector is romping today. SLV +2.9%, JJC +2.4%, JJG +1.5%, USO +1.0%, JJS +3.1%. The swiss franc is having none of this "risk on" move, continuing to hit new all-time highs vs. the euro.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:22 PM | 2 Comments
  • AABA

    Speaking at an analysts' meeting, Yahoo (YHOO +1.2%) CEO Carol Bartz sticks up for her execs'...

    Speaking at an analysts' meeting, Yahoo (YHOO +1.2%) CEO Carol Bartz sticks up for her execs' handling of the Alipay-ownership controversy, saying they're working to ensure Alibaba Group (OTC:ALBCF) is compensated appropriately for its Alipay stake. Some investors say Yahoo's value is all in Asian assets, while Bartz says Alipay is "extremely immaterial" to financials; someone may be wrong there.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:01 PM
  • TSLA

    Tesla Motors (TSLA +3.6%) announces a follow-on offering of 5.3M shares, from which it will use...

    Tesla Motors (TSLA +3.6%) announces a follow-on offering of 5.3M shares, from which it will use funds to develop its Model X crossover electric vehicle. CEO Elon Musk will buy 1.5M shares in a concurrent offering.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:29 AM | 3 Comments
  • SQBG

    Martha Stewart Living Omnimedia (MSO +21.2%) shares jump after announcing that Blackstone has...

    Martha Stewart Living Omnimedia (MSO +21.2%) shares jump after announcing that Blackstone has been retained to explore strategic partnership opportunities. The company also announces that Lisa Gersh will become President and COO next month. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:37 AM | 2 Comments
  • CPKI

    P-E firm Golden Gate Capital orders the whole pie and agrees to buy California Pizza Kitchen...

    P-E firm Golden Gate Capital orders the whole pie and agrees to buy California Pizza Kitchen (NASDAQ:CPKI) for $470M. The $18.50 a share offer is an 11% premium to the restaurant's $16.71 close yesterday. Shares +9.8% to $18.35.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:42 AM | 1 Comment
  • RL

    Polo Ralph Lauren (NYSE:RL): FQ4 EPS of $0.74 misses by $0.05. Revenue of $1.38B (+1% Y/Y)...

    Polo Ralph Lauren (NYSE:RL): FQ4 EPS of $0.74 misses by $0.05. Revenue of $1.38B (+1% Y/Y) misses by $0.01B. Shares -4.2% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:07 AM
  • AEO

    American Eagle Outfitters (NYSE:AEO): Q1 EPS of $0.14 in-line. Revenue of $609.6M (-6% Y/Y)...

    American Eagle Outfitters (NYSE:AEO): Q1 EPS of $0.14 in-line. Revenue of $609.6M (-6% Y/Y) misses by $27.6M. Sees Q2 EPS of $0.10-0.13. Shares +1.8% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:04 AM
  • AMAT

    Applied Materials (NASDAQ:AMAT) -2.1% premarket - although up from -5.25% - after it warned late...

    Applied Materials (NASDAQ:AMAT) -2.1% premarket - although up from -5.25% - after it warned late yesterday that FQ3 revenue would fall 3%-10% from FQ2 and come in below forecasts. The company attributed the weakness to customers delaying spending due to the difficult economy.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:01 AM
  • FRO

    Frontline (NYSE:FRO): Q1 EPS of $0.20 may not be comparable to the consensus -$0.16. Revenue of...

    Frontline (NYSE:FRO): Q1 EPS of $0.20 may not be comparable to the consensus -$0.16. Revenue of $234.8M (-29.2% Y/Y) beats by $65.5M. Shares -6.4% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:01 AM
  • CEDC

    Russian billionaire Roman Abramovich isn't bidding to buy Central European Distribution Corp....

    Russian billionaire Roman Abramovich isn't bidding to buy Central European Distribution Corp. (NASDAQ:CEDC), says an Abramovich spokesman, but rumors to the contrary have CEDC, the world’s largest producer of vodka, +5.75% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:54 AM
  • HRL

    Hormel Foods (NYSE:HRL): FQ2 EPS of $0.40 in-line. Revenue of $1.96B (+15.2% Y/Y) beats by...

    Hormel Foods (NYSE:HRL): FQ2 EPS of $0.40 in-line. Revenue of $1.96B (+15.2% Y/Y) beats by $0.14B. FY'11 EPS guidance raised to $1.67-1.73. Shares +3.3% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 7:50 AM
  • HAL

    Halliburton (NYSE:HAL) +2.2% premarket. Not seeing a lot of news on the stock, though there's...

    Halliburton (NYSE:HAL) +2.2% premarket. Not seeing a lot of news on the stock, though there's chatter of a tier 1 firm upgrade.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:42 AM
  • BSX

    Boston Scientific (NYSE:BSX) +2% premarket after announcing the FDA approval and U.S. launch of...

    Boston Scientific (NYSE:BSX) +2% premarket after announcing the FDA approval and U.S. launch of a coronary stent system. It was also upgraded this morning to Neutral from Sell at Goldman Sachs, which no longer sees material downside to consensus estimates.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:32 AM
  • RAE

    RAE Systems (NYSEMKT:RAE) amends its merger agreement with Vector Capital, with investors now...

    RAE Systems (NYSEMKT:RAE) amends its merger agreement with Vector Capital, with investors now set to get $2.25/share instead of the initial $2.05 offered. The amendment follows a rival offer of $2.20/share yesterday from Battery Ventures and SFW Capital Partners. Shares +8.3% to $2.22. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 7:29 AM
  • CSCO

    Cisco (CSCO -2%) lowers its Q4 revenue guidance to 'relatively flat' from 'flat to up 2%,' and...

    Cisco (CSCO -2%) lowers its Q4 revenue guidance to 'relatively flat' from 'flat to up 2%,' and expects Q4 gross margin to be slightly lower than in Q3. "We also expect that operating income, net income, and earnings per share for [Q4 2011] will likely continue to decline on a year-over-year basis." (10-Q)
     
     
     
     
    | 7:17 AM | 4 Comments
  • VVUS

    Vivus (NASDAQ:VVUS) announces positive results from a Phase III trial of avanafil for the...

    Vivus (NASDAQ:VVUS) announces positive results from a Phase III trial of avanafil for the treatment of erectile dysfunction, saying the drug met all primary endpoints with no serious adverse events. Shares +5.8%. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 6:55 AM
  • STP

    Suntech Power (NYSE:STP): Q1 EPS of $0.17 misses by $0.18. Revenue of $877M (-7.2% Y/Y) beats by...

    Suntech Power (NYSE:STP): Q1 EPS of $0.17 misses by $0.18. Revenue of $877M (-7.2% Y/Y) beats by $13.48M. Shares +1.2% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 6:00 AM
